title: Liver Decompensation Risk after Hepatectomy for Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC)
desc: The Liver Decompensation Risk after Hepatectomy predicts risk of liver decompensation after hepatectomy for hepatocellular carcinoma.

orgreference.text: Citterio D, Facciorusso A, Sposito C, Rota R, Bhoori S, Mazzaferro V. Hierarchic Interaction of Factors Associated With Liver Decompensation After Resection for Hepatocellular Carcinoma. JAMA Surg. 2016;151(9):846-53.

data.evidence:
Portal hypertension = at least F1 esophageal varices (i.e., small and straight) on endoscopy OR platelets <100,000/μL with splenomegaly (>12 cm diameter).

Extension of hepatectomy: major resection = removal of ≥3 adjacent segments.
